title: Yet Another Programming Exercise Interoperability Language
description: JSON schema for describing a programming exercise package, based on PExIL - an XML dialect that aims to consolidate all the data required in the programming exercise life-cycle. YAPExIL aims for simplicity while covering most features of a task package as described by Verhoeff's model, i.e., a unit for collecting, storing, archiving, and exchanging all information concerning with a programming task.

module.title: Module
module.description: Module in which the exercise is in (description of its main topic).

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of programming exercise to be solved.

event.title: Event
event.description: Event at which the exercise was created (if any).

programmingLanguages.title: Programming Languages
programmingLanguages.description: Programming languages in which the code can be written.

created_at.title: Creation Date
created_at.description: Date of creation of the exercise.

updated_at.title: Last Update Date
updated_at.description: Date of the last update to the exercise.

instructions.title: Instructions
instructions.description: Instructions to teachers about the exercise.

embeddables.title: Embeddables
embeddables.description: Images, videos, and other files that can be embedded in the statement.

libraries.title: Libraries
libraries.description: Code libraries that can be used by solutions. It may be used during compilation and/or execution phases.

static_correctors.title: Static Correctors
static_correctors.description: External programs that are invoked before dynamic correction to classify/process the program's source code.

dynamic_correctors.title: Dynamic Correctors
dynamic_correctors.description: External programs that are invoked after the main correction to classify each run.

test_generators.title: Test Generators
test_generators.description: External programs that generate the test cases to validate a solution.

feedback_generators.title: Feedback Generators
feedback_generators.description: External programs that generate the feedback to give to the student about his/her attempt to achieve a solution.

skeletons.title: Skeletons
skeletons.description: Part of a solution that is provided to the students.

templates.title: Templates
templates.description: Part of a solution that wraps students' code without their awareness.

testsets.title: Test Sets
testsets.description: Set(s) of test cases to validate if attempts are correct.
